result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Durron D Daniels

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on January 31, 2023 at 02:30 pm.

1:39 PM Defendant Durron D Daniels not in court.  Attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen Jr. in court for Durron D Daniels. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

First appearance in trial court. 

Defendant had called the Clerk's office and advised he was unable to get off of work today. Defendant works as security for MPS, and requests to have the Defendant's appearance waived today, and requests plea/sentencing. State does not object.

Court sets plea/sentencing hearing. Defense to advise of current address.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 31, 2023 at 02:30 pm.

as to Durron D Daniels, Notice of Assignment of Judge, updated address and sent to Defendant
Hearing on September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:46 AM Defendant Durron D Daniels in court with attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
